result.title: h2static
result.summary: Tiny static web server with TLS and HTTP/2 support
result.description:
Static web server using the builtin Go http library.

It supports HTTP/2 and TLS.

This snap provides both an command "h2static" that can be run by any user,
with access to the user home directory, and a system-wide daemon.

The daemon is configured with the following options:

  - listen

    the "address:port" for the service to listen on. The address can be
    omitted (e.g. :8080) to bind all addresses.

    If this option is not set, the service will not be started.

  - serve-path

    the directory to serve content from. it's set to $SNAP_COMMON if not
    specified.

    If the "removable-media" interface is connected, a path under /media can
    also be used.

  - disable-h2

    set to true to disable HTTP/2 support.

  - tls.cert, tls.key

    ASCII content of the TLS certificate. If both are set, HTTPS support will
    be enabled.
result.name: h2static
